"Trace "If they awoo, cleave them in two" Legacy"
What's with the 'cleave them in two'? Is that to do with Templar! Trace?
Man, this one (1) page a week thing is killing me. I mean, I couldn't do it faster myself; but still.
Also, thoes collers cause Basitins to explode? ...How?
Basitins resist magic, causing a magic-antimagic feedback loop.
Like Dwarves in Lord of the Rings.
They're naturally resistant to magic, and the effects thereof.
Also I'm lying. I'm not sure what would happen if a Basitin wore it.
...So it would look like the Slave Collers from Fallout?
Well, isn't that one of the joys of writing a comic? Having stuff happen that you never dreamed about?

Of course, the only time that happened with me was writing a star trek/Doctor Who crossover ... I realised that I disliked one of the characters, and then was surprised at a few plot devices that opened up in my head.
Ok, have I broken the chat with a wall of text again?
@CrimsonQuill Create good lore not so easily as you think. You should always take care that new knowledge does not contradict what has been said before.
(there was supposed to be a saxophone emote in there...)
I realised that one thing might contradict the lore
And added a plot device to explain it
By using the idea of an 'experimental device'
Basic premise is: Put three Daleks on a Starship just like the 2009 Enterprise, and watch them kill everyone.
And as we all know, sketches are 100% canon.
The 6th sketch Tom had done for Patreon of Keith.
Actually, I'm going to throw a question into the air.
If our Resident dragon Nora tried to change a Basitin into a Keidran, or anything, would the magic just bounce off?
Or shall you leave us writhing in mystery?
Keidran are really only resisntant to minor magics like those of the fairies.
Templar forces were the deciding factor in the Basitin-Keidran war. And Trace alone had the magical affinity to destroy the King's guard.
Nora is magnitudes more powerful than Trace.
Nora's magic would still affect most Basitin.
Basitin become more resist to magic the stronger they are. Adelaide is almost completely immune to direct magic.
Except the King. Nora tries to gender bend her, and it just bounces back and transforms Nora into Neil.
(Though of course you could still use magic to throw a rock at her or something)
I was wondering how she survived all that ruckus she went through...
I think I might have a suggestion there...
See, when I think about 'Resistant to magic', my immediate idea is similar to the 'null' in Sage's Yosh!
Someone who's immune to magic completely.
Indeed, one of my favourite daydreams is to put some SAS Soldiers in a Harry Potter setting, immune to magic, and see them assassinate Death Eaters.
...that's like putting someone immune to bullets into a war setting, what's the point of someone who can't be harmed by hs enemies, seems pretty boring
In private, behind locked doors, and it's advisable that you wash your hands when you're done.
Oh, I use carbolic soap to remove the leftover corruption.
I don't think I really have an O.C. though...

They're just a reason for me to invent the same type of power armor in my head a hundred times.
